column1: 61 year old male patient. On March 3, 2020 he accesses the DEAS of the AOU Careggi (Florence) for severe dyspnoea, mental confusion and prolonged enticement for recent upper airway infection; non-smoker, diabetes mellitus in insulin therapy and high blood pressure.

Blood chemistry tests: white blood count 11.2; polymerase chain reaction 301 (VN <5); lactate dehydrogenase 738 (VN 135-225); Fibrinogen 798 (VN 200-400); international normalized ratio 1.4. Blood gas analysis: PaO2 82; PCO2 32.
Performs pulmonary angio-CT in the case of acute pulmonary thromboembolism

Multiple areas of ground-glass extended widely in both lungs with initial consolidation aspects in the basal regions where subpleural savings are noted; moderate volumetric reduction of both lungs coexists.
The patient is intubated and undergoes therapy with Lopinavir-Ritonavir (Kaletra) and Chloroquine (Plaquenil).
Appearance of basal parenchymal area of ​​sedation sn suspected for bacterial superinfection.
Introduction of antibiotic therapy (piperallicin + tazobactam) and remdesivir.
